Police have taken a statement from a steward who alleges Manchester City striker Sergio Aguero hit them at the end of the game against Bournemouth.

Aguero and his team mates were celebrating Raheem Sterling's late winner in the 2-1 victory at the Vitality Stadium.

The City players went to celebrate with the fans, with the stewards intervening as they spilled onto the pitch, when the incident took place.

BREAKING NEWS

Sky sources: Manchester City will make an offer for Alexis Sanchez this week.

We understand City are desperate to sign Sanchez from Arsenal before the window closes on Thursday.

One source has confirmed to us that City are willing to offer Raheem Sterling as part of the deal. However, another player who could be involved in a potential deal is Sergio Aguero – although City have made it clear that he is not for sale.

We are also told that Sanchez is unhappy at Arsenal and wants to leave. Arsenal’s position remains that he is happy and staying – even though he has less than a year left on his contract.

BREAKING NEWS

There's more on the Alexis Sanchez situation with TV 13 in Chile reporting that Sanchez has asked to leave the Chile training camp to “conduct personal business”.

Man City will make offer for Alexis Sanchez. Willing to offer Raheem Sterling to Arsenal as part of deal. 1 source says Arsenal want Aguero
